answers.answer: I just had mine done and it only was 1hr. I got a little dizzy but, not horribly sick. Still waiting for the results. Good luck!

I just took the 1 hr and blew it! Now I have to take the 3 hr! Ugh, holidays! Too many good sweets!

They will draw some blood, like a normalBlood test. Then you'll have to drink a sort of juice, which is a glucose solution. Then you'll have to wait for an hour and they'll draw blood again.  And that's it.

I have had it on all four.... there is a 3 hour one....you fast the night before then the next morning they take a blood sample then give you a glucose drink then an hour later they take another blood sample then an hour after that they take the last blood sample....it checks the different levels of sugar in your blood.I wasnt sick on any of them....just starving afterwards
Walking a little while you wait will help you pass the test. Don't just sit there the whole time, take a 5 min brisk walk at least to get things pumping

I took mine yesterday, it was only about an hour. I was told not to eat anything I took the test, he checked the heartbeat, measured my belly, weighed me, and then took a blood sample! I was really thirsty and a little nauseous afterwards but felt fine

I did the 3 hour test. Its not much different then the 1 hour test. But as you have to fast before hand I felt dizzy after it was over. Bring some protient snack like cheese or something for afterward.
